page.text: 14733 Glassboro Avenue., Jamaica, NY. 11435
John Jay College of Criminal Justice, CUNY New York, NY
BA Criminal Justice, Graduated: June 2015
GPA: 3.3
John Jay College CUNY Service Corps- Department of Labor, Brooklyn, NY
Intern (September 2013- April 2014)
• Assist clients with filing document for unemployment
• Guide clients on how to build up resumes and cover letters
• Scanned and faxed resumes
• Taught clients with little computer skills on how to do basic things on the computer
• Worked closely with managers in other departments on updating policies and procedures for
client service.
• Resolved client complaints
CVS Pharmacy, New York, NY
Customer Service Representative, July 2012- September 2013
• Assisted customers with purchases and processed transactions
• Answered the telephone using appropriate greeting
• Restock and inventory duties as needed
• Completed minor in-store repairs
• Assisted pharmacy personnel when needed
• Reacted to potential shoplifters following company guidelines
Attorney & Counselor at Law, New York, NY
Intern (June 2011-August 2012)
• Worked with immigration attorney to support management of office
• Assisted lawyer with screening client calls
• Received and directed visitors
• Troubleshot minor technical computer problems
• Scheduled client appointments and performed routine office work using basic clerical skills.
• Filed and processed immigration forms for clients.
• Created, processed, and tracked office supply orders
Redeemed Christian Church of God, Queens, NY.
Assistant Financial Officer (September 2009- Present)
• Assist with the financial account, and collection and totaling of funds gathered weekly.
Redeemed Christian Church of God, Queens, NY.
Teen Youth Leader (September 2009- Present)
• Unite and mentor teenagers ages 12-17 to develop interpersonal skills and knowledge of human
relations.
• Solved issues by encouraging, supervising, negotiating and consulting.
John Jay College of Criminal Justice, New York, NY.
• Active member of the Inter-varsity Christian Club
• Active member of the International Students Association
• Active member of the African Students Association
• Assisted disabled students to take notes in class.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
